original: @67a # // rgya gar skad du //
analyzed: @67a # // rgya gar skad du //
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: shr'i tree lo kya bi dza ya mandalo pa yi ka a'arya tattva sam gra dha tantro ddi dhi ta /
analyzed: shr'i tree lo kya bi dza ya mandalo pa yi ka a'arya tattva sam gra dha tantro ddi dhi ta /
translated: Śrī Trailokyavijaya-maṇḍalopāyikāryatattvasaṃgraha-tantroddhṛt

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: dpal khams gsum rnam par gyal ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga 'phags pa de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i rgyud las btus pa ;
analyzed: dpal khams gsum rnam par gyal ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga 'phags pa de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i rgyud las btus pa ;
translated: The ritual of the maṇḍala of the glorious conqueror of the three worlds, extracted from the Tattva-saṃgraha Tantra

original: mgon po 'jam pa'i dbyangs la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: mgon po 'jam pa'i dbyangs la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the protector Mañjughoṣa!

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed Vajrasattva!

original: khyab bdag gdul dga' 'dul ba po //
analyzed: khyab bdag gdul dga' 'dul ba po //
translated: The all-pervading one, the tamer, the discipliner,

original: rdo rje h'um mdzad phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: rdo rje h'um mdzad phyag 'tshal te //
translated: Vajra-humkara, I pay homage.🔽I will explain the ritual of the maṇḍala

original: 'jig rten gsum rgyal 'byung ba yi //🔽dkyil 'khor cho ga bshad par bya //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum rgyal 'byung ba yi // dkyil 'khor cho ga bshad par bya //
translated: Arising from the conqueror of the three worlds.

original: de la re zhig slob dpon gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du zhugs shing dbang thob pa rigs pa'i sdoms pa yongs su bzung ba /
analyzed: de la re zhig slob dpon gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du zhugs shing dbang thob pa rigs pa'i sdoms pa yongs su bzung ba /
translated: To begin, the master should enter the secret maṇḍala, obtain empowerment, fully uphold the vows of the family,

original: gsang ba'i cho ga thams cad kyi bya ba shes pa //
analyzed: gsang ba'i cho ga thams cad kyi bya ba shes pa //
translated: Know how to perform all secret rituals,

original: dpa' ba brtan pa /
analyzed: dpa' ba brtan pa /
translated: Be courageous and steadfast,

original: spro ba / che pa /
analyzed: spro ba / che pa /
translated: Enthusiastic, magnanimous,

original: mkhas pa / dul ba /
analyzed: mkhas pa / dul ba /
translated: disciplined,

original: 'dul ba'i kun du sbyor ba la gnas pa /
analyzed: 'dul ba'i kun du sbyor ba la gnas pa /
translated: and persevering in the practice of discipline.

original: dad pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: dad pa dang ldan pa /
translated: He is faithful

original: chos zab mo la lhag par mos pa /
analyzed: chos zab mo la lhag par mos pa /
translated: and has a deep interest in the profound Dharma.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su skyob pa'i blo can /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su skyob pa'i blo can /
translated: He is a person who is ready to protect all sentient beings.

original: lus dang srog la ltos pa med pa /
analyzed: lus dang srog la ltos pa med pa /
translated: He is indifferent to his body and life.

original: grogs kyi dkyil 'khor mthong ba /
analyzed: grogs kyi dkyil 'khor mthong ba /
translated: He is a person who has seen the circle of friends.

original: dad pas byang chub tu sems bskyed pa //
analyzed: dad pas byang chub tu sems bskyed pa //
translated: He is a person who has generated the mind of enlightenment through faith.

original: gsang ba'i tshul gyis cho ga'i bya ba shes pa /
analyzed: gsang ba'i tshul gyis cho ga'i bya ba shes pa /
translated: He is a person who knows the performance of the secret rites.

original: gtsang zhing gtsang mar spyod pa /
analyzed: gtsang zhing gtsang mar spyod pa /
translated: He is a person who is pure and practices pure conduct.

original: gsang ba'i cho ga'i bya ba la mkhas pa /
analyzed: gsang ba'i cho ga'i bya ba la mkhas pa /
translated: He is a person who is skilled in the performance of the secret rites.

original: snying stobs dang ldan pa /🔽blo brtan pa dang lhan cig gam /
analyzed: snying stobs dang ldan pa / blo brtan pa dang lhan cig gam /
translated: He is a person who is courageous.🔽He should perform the preliminary practice either together with a companion who has a firm mind

original: yang na grogs bzang med pa ri bo'am /
analyzed: yang na grogs bzang med pa ri bo'am /
translated: or else alone in a place that is agreeable to the mind, such as a mountain,

original: nags sam / chu 'gram mam /
analyzed: nags sam / chu 'gram mam /
translated: a forest, a riverbank,

original: skyed mos tshal lam /
analyzed: skyed mos tshal lam /
translated: a garden,

original: gtsug lag khang la sogs pa'i yid dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnas su sngon du bsnyen @67b pa bya'o ;
analyzed: gtsug lag khang la sogs pa'i yid dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnas su sngon du bsnyen @67b pa bya'o ;
translated: or a temple.

original: / de la dang po re zhig rim pa 'dis rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa'i khrus brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: / de la dang po re zhig rim pa 'dis rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa'i khrus brtsam par bya'o //
translated: First, one should begin the bathing ritual by engaging in the following procedure.

original: khro bo ti r'inti ri'i phyag rgya bcings la /
analyzed: khro bo ti r'inti ri'i phyag rgya bcings la /
translated: Form the mudra of Krodha Tīrntrīrti

original: snying gar bzhag ste /
analyzed: snying gar bzhag ste /
translated: and place it on the heart.

original: aom dhu pe dhu pe pi k'a ya dhu pi pra dzva la ni sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom dhu pe dhu pe pi k'a ya dhu pi pra dzva la ni sv'a h'a /
translated: Reciting “Oṃ dhūpe dhūpe pika dhūpe prajvālāya svāhā,”

original: zhes zlos shing bdag nyid 'bar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes zlos shing bdag nyid 'bar bar bya'o //
translated: one should burn oneself.

original: lam tum zhes bya bas go bgos la rdo rje gnod spyin gyi mche ba'i phyag rgya bcings te /
analyzed: lam tum zhes bya bas go bgos la rdo rje gnod spyin gyi mche ba'i phyag rgya bcings te /
translated: With “lam tum,” one should don the armor and form the mudra of Vajrayakṣadaṃṣṭra.

original: bgegs thams cad bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: bgegs thams cad bza' bar bya'o //
translated: One should consume all obstacles.

original: yang de yid dang aa zhes bya ba zlos shing bdud rtsi thab sbyor gyis yang aom bhu ra dzva la h'um sv'a h'a /
analyzed: yang de yid dang aa zhes bya ba zlos shing bdud rtsi thab sbyor gyis yang aom bhu ra dzva la h'um sv'a h'a /
translated: Again, with the mind and “a,” one should recite “Oṃ bhūr jvālā hūṃ svāhā.”

original: zhes zlos shing spyi bor chu khyor ba gsum blug par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes zlos shing spyi bor chu khyor ba gsum blug par bya'o //
translated: Reciting this, one should pour three handfuls of water on one’s head.

original: rig pa 'di nyid kyis sa gtsang ma blangs la cha gsum du byas te /
analyzed: rig pa 'di nyid kyis sa gtsang ma blangs la cha gsum du byas te /
translated: With this very awareness, one should take some clean earth, divide it into three parts,

original: cha gcig gis rked pa man chad bkru /
analyzed: cha gcig gis rked pa man chad bkru /
translated: and with one part wash from the waist down.

original: gnyis pas lus thams cad bkru'o //
analyzed: gnyis pas lus thams cad bkru'o //
translated: With the second part, one should wash the whole body.

original: gsum pas lag pa bkrus la nye reg byas te /
analyzed: gsum pas lag pa bkrus la nye reg byas te /
translated: The third one washes his hands and performs the rite of purification.

original: rang gi sngags dang phyag rgya spyi bor chu blugs la /
analyzed: rang gi sngags dang phyag rgya spyi bor chu blugs la /
translated: Having poured water on his head with his mantra and seal,

original: bdag nyid rdo rje h'um mdzad du byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: bdag nyid rdo rje h'um mdzad du byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: he should bless himself as Vajra Humkara.

original: chu las langs nas rdo rje sems dpa' zlos shing chu'i bsrung ba bsal la /🔽h'um bzhi rdo rje'i tshig gis yid la zlos sing lha'i khang pa'am /
analyzed: chu las langs nas rdo rje sems dpa' zlos shing chu'i bsrung ba bsal la / h'um bzhi rdo rje'i tshig gis yid la zlos sing lha'i khang pa'am /
translated: Having risen from the water, he should recite Vajrasattva and remove the protection of the water.

original: ri bo la sogs pa'i gnas su 'khrus dang nye reg byas te /
analyzed: ri bo la sogs pa'i gnas su 'khrus dang nye reg byas te /
translated: Reciting mentally the four Hūṃs and the vajra words, he should bathe and perform the rite of purification in a divine palace or on a mountain, etc.

original: rdo rje rtse mo mngon par bzlas pa'i chus gos la sogs pa la bsang gtor byas la /
analyzed: rdo rje rtse mo mngon par bzlas pa'i chus gos la sogs pa la bsang gtor byas la /
translated: Having sprinkled his clothes, etc., with water incanted with the Vajraśekhara mantra,

original: gnas khang la sogs par chu de yid kyis lha'i khang pa'i nang kun du bgegs bsal bar byas nas stan bde ba la sogs par ji ltar bde bar 'dug ste /
analyzed: gnas khang la sogs par chu de yid kyis lha'i khang pa'i nang kun du bgegs bsal bar byas nas stan bde ba la sogs par ji ltar bde bar 'dug ste /
translated: he should mentally sprinkle that water throughout the divine palace, removing obstacles from the dwelling place, etc.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa nang du bcings la /🔽mdzub mo gnyis gshibs te rtse mor byas nas /
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa nang du bcings la / mdzub mo gnyis gshibs te rtse mor byas nas /
translated: Then, sitting on a comfortable seat, etc., as he pleases, he should bind the vajra fist inside.🔽Having placed the two index fingers side by side and pointed,

original: mthe bong gnyis gyen du bltas par gshibs te /
analyzed: mthe bong gnyis gyen du bltas par gshibs te /
translated: he should place the two thumbs upright and side by side.

original: skyil mo krung gi steng du bzhag la /
analyzed: skyil mo krung gi steng du bzhag la /
translated: Place it on top of the crossed legs.🔽Recite three times:

original: aom sarba bi shuddhe dharma t'a badzra siddhi h'um zhes lan gsum bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: aom sarba bi shuddhe dharma t'a badzra siddhi h'um zhes lan gsum bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Oṃ sarva-viśudha-dharmāṇi vajra-siddhi hūṃ.

original: de nas lkog ma'i phyogs su hr'i: las padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bsams pa'i lce'i padma'i 'dab mar h'um las rdo rje rtse lnga pa dkar po bsams la /
analyzed: de nas lkog ma'i phyogs su hr'i: las padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bsams pa'i lce'i padma'i 'dab mar h'um las rdo rje rtse lnga pa dkar po bsams la /
translated: Then, in the throat region, imagine an eight-petaled lotus from hrīḥ. On the tongue lotus, imagine a white five-tined vajra from hūṃ.

original: badzra dzi hva zhes bya ba'i rig pa 'dis byin gnyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: badzra dzi hva zhes bya ba'i rig pa 'dis byin gnyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: Consecrate the two with this knowledge mantra:🔽vajra-jihva.

original: lag pa gnyis su yang aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis bsams la /
analyzed: lag pa gnyis su yang aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis bsams la /
translated: Also, in the two hands, imagine two moon maṇḍalas from a.

original: de gyis kyi steng du h'um gnyis la rdo rje bsam zhing lag pa'i sor mo yang rdo rje rtse mor bskyed la /🔽'og nas bshad pa'i rim pas bgegs gzhom pa la sogs pa byas @68a * //
analyzed: de gyis kyi steng du h'um gnyis la rdo rje bsam zhing lag pa'i sor mo yang rdo rje rtse mor bskyed la / 'og nas bshad pa'i rim pas bgegs gzhom pa la sogs pa byas @68a * //
translated: On top of those, imagine two hūṃs, and also imagine vajras on the fingers.

original: nas rdo rje 'khor lo'i phyag rgya bcings la /
analyzed: nas rdo rje 'khor lo'i phyag rgya bcings la /
translated: Having performed the destruction of obstructors and so on according to the procedure that will be explained below, form the vajra wheel mudra.🔽Recite:

original: aom badzra tsakra h'um zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: aom badzra tsakra h'um zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Oṃ vajra-cakra hūṃ.

original: de la phyag rgya ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la phyag rgya ni 'di yin te /
translated: The mudra is as follows:

original: rdo rje khu tshur gyis bcings nas //
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gyis bcings nas //
translated: Binding with the vajra fist,

original: mdzub mo mthe'u chung rdo rje mdud //
analyzed: mdzub mo mthe'u chung rdo rje mdud //
translated: the index and little fingers are vajra-bound.

original: rdo rje 'khor lo zhes grags te //
analyzed: rdo rje 'khor lo zhes grags te //
translated: This is known as the vajra wheel,

original: dkyil 'khor thams cad sgrub byed yin //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad sgrub byed yin //
translated: which accomplishes all maṇḍalas.

original: rigs thams cad kyi 'khor lo bskor ba 'dis phyogs thams cad du g-yas nas bskor la khar bzhag nas lta bzhin du sngags lan brgya rtsa brgyad ru bzlas na /
analyzed: rigs thams cad kyi 'khor lo bskor ba 'dis phyogs thams cad du g-yas nas bskor la khar bzhag nas lta bzhin du sngags lan brgya rtsa brgyad ru bzlas na /
translated: By turning this wheel of all families to the right in all directions, placing it in the mouth, and reciting the mantra one hundred and eight times while looking,

original: rigs thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor du zhugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor du zhugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: one will enter the maṇḍala of all families.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor blos mngon sun lta bur dmigs la me tog la sogs pas lha thams cad yang dag par mchod de phyogs thams cad nas dkyil 'khor lnga pa dang 'dis phyag bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor blos mngon sun lta bur dmigs la me tog la sogs pas lha thams cad yang dag par mchod de phyogs thams cad nas dkyil 'khor lnga pa dang 'dis phyag bya'o //
translated: Then, visualizing the maṇḍala as if it were in the sky, one should make offerings to all the deities with flowers and so forth, and make obeisance from all directions with this five-part maṇḍala:

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya w'aka tsitta pra na me na badzra banda nam ka ro mi /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya w'aka tsitta pra na me na badzra banda nam ka ro mi /
translated: Oṃ, I pay homage to all tathāgatas, with the homage of body, speech, and mind, I pay homage with the vajra homage.

original: de nas phyag bzhi bya ste /
analyzed: de nas phyag bzhi bya ste /
translated: Then, one should make four prostrations:

original: 'di ltar rdo rje thal mo brkyang la sngags 'di dang lus thams cad kyis phyag bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdo rje thal mo brkyang la sngags 'di dang lus thams cad kyis phyag bya'o //
translated: Thus, extend the vajra palms, and with this mantra and with the whole body, make homage.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta pu dzo pastha n'a ya a'atma nam ni ry'a ta y'a mi sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra satva aa dhi tishtha sva mam /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta pu dzo pastha n'a ya a'atma nam ni ry'a ta y'a mi sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra satva aa dhi tishtha sva mam /
translated: oṃ sarvatathāgatapūjopasthānāya ātmanā niyataṃ yāmi sarvatathāgatavajrasatvādhiṣṭite svāhā

original: de nas de bzhin du gnas pa las rdo rje thal mo snying gar sbyar la /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin du gnas pa las rdo rje thal mo snying gar sbyar la /
translated: Then, remaining as before, join the vajra palms to the heart,

original: 'dis dpral bas phyag bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis dpral bas phyag bya'o //
translated: and with this, make homage with the forehead.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza aa bhi she ka a'atma n'am ni rya ta y'a mi sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra ratna aa bhi shi nytsa m'am /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza aa bhi she ka a'atma n'am ni rya ta y'a mi sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra ratna aa bhi shi nytsa m'am /
translated: oṃ sarvatathāgatapūjābhiṣe kāya ātmanā niyataṃ yāmi sarvatathāgatavajraratnābhiṣiñca māṃ

original: de na sde bzhin du gna pa la rdo rje thal mo spyi bor bzhag ste 'di dang khas phyag bya'o //
analyzed: de na sde bzhin du gna pa la rdo rje thal mo spyi bor bzhag ste 'di dang khas phyag bya'o //
translated: Then, remaining as before, place the vajra palms on the crown, and with this, make homage with the mouth.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza pra brta n'a ya a'atma n'am ni ry'a ta y'a mi sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra dharmma pra brda ya m'am /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza pra brta n'a ya a'atma n'am ni ry'a ta y'a mi sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra dharmma pra brda ya m'am /
translated: oṃ sarvatathāgatapūjāpravarttanāya ātmanā niyataṃ yāmi sarvatathāgatavajradharma pravartaya māṃ

original: de nas de bzhin du gnas pa las rdo rje thal mo spyi bo nas phab ste snying gar sbyar la byang phyogs su spyi bo sa la reg par byas nas 'dis phyag bya'o //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin du gnas pa las rdo rje thal mo spyi bo nas phab ste snying gar sbyar la byang phyogs su spyi bo sa la reg par byas nas 'dis phyag bya'o //
translated: Then, remaining in that same position, one should lower the vajra palms from the crown of the head and join them at the heart, and having touched one's head to the ground in the northern direction, one should pay homage with this:

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza karmma ne a'atma n'am ni ry'a ta y'a mi sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra karmma ku ru m'am /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza karmma ne a'atma n'am ni ry'a ta y'a mi sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra karmma ku ru m'am /
translated: Oṃ, all tathāgatas, please attend to me! I offer this to you! All tathāgatas, please perform the vajra activity for me!

original: phyag 'tshal ba'i phyag rgya bcings nas sdig pa thams cad bshags par bgyi'o ;
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba'i phyag rgya bcings nas sdig pa thams cad bshags par bgyi'o ;
translated: Having formed the mudrā of homage, one should confess all one's misdeeds:

original: / phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rdo rje dang / rin po che dang / padma dang / las kyi rigs su bzhugs pa thams cad dang / snying pod dang / phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags dang /
analyzed: / phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rdo rje dang / rin po che dang / padma dang / las kyi rigs su bzhugs pa thams cad dang / snying pod dang / phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags dang /
translated: All buddhas and bodhisattvas of the ten directions, and all those abiding in the tathāgata, vajra, jewel, lotus, and action families, and all essence mantras, mudrās, secret mantras,

original: rig sngags kyi lha thams cad @68b bdag la dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: rig sngags kyi lha thams cad @68b bdag la dgongs su gsol /
translated: and knowledge mantras, please heed me!

original: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rdo rje dang / rin po che dang / padma dang / las kyi rigs su bzhugs pa thams cad dang / snying po dang phyag rgya dang /
analyzed: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rdo rje dang / rin po che dang / padma dang / las kyi rigs su bzhugs pa thams cad dang / snying po dang phyag rgya dang /
translated: I, [name], in the presence of all the buddhas and bodhisattvas of the ten directions, and of all those dwelling in the tathāgata, vajra, jewel, lotus, and action families, and of all the deities of essence mantras, mudrā seals,

original: gsang sngags dang rigs sngags kyi lha thams cad kyi spyan sngar sdig pa thams cad bla na med pas so sor bshags par bgyi'o //🔽phyogs bcu na 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas dang // 'phags pa yan thos yang dag par song ba dang / yang dag par zhugs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: gsang sngags dang rigs sngags kyi lha thams cad kyi spyan sngar sdig pa thams cad bla na med pas so sor bshags par bgyi'o // phyogs bcu na 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas dang // 'phags pa yan thos yang dag par song ba dang / yang dag par zhugs pa rnams dang /
translated: and knowledge mantras, confess each and every misdeed without exception.🔽I rejoice in all the merit of the buddhas and bodhisattvas of the past, future, and present in the ten directions, of the pratyekabuddhas, of the noble hearers who have gone correctly and are correctly practicing,

original: sems can gyi tshogs thams cad kyi bsod nams thams cad la rgya cher rjes su yi rang bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs thams cad kyi bsod nams thams cad la rgya cher rjes su yi rang bar bgyi'o //
translated: and of all the assemblies of sentient beings.

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mi mdzad pa thams cad la chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bya ba'i phyir bskul bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mi mdzad pa thams cad la chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bya ba'i phyir bskul bar bgyi'o //
translated: I will request all the blessed buddhas in the ten directions who are not turning the wheel of Dharma to turn the wheel of Dharma.

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bzhed pa gang yin pa de thams cad la mya ngan las mi 'da' bar gsol bar 'tshol lo //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bzhed pa gang yin pa de thams cad la mya ngan las mi 'da' bar gsol bar 'tshol lo //
