analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis rtse mo sbyar la bzlog ste spyi bor gzhag pa 'di ni rdo rje gtsug tor gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: and the two index fingers are crossed and placed on the crown of the head. This is the mudrā of Vajroṣṇīṣa.

original: yang rdo rje zhags pas de nyid bcing par bya ste /
analyzed: yang rdo rje zhags pas de nyid bcing par bya ste /
translated: Again, one should bind with the vajra noose.

original: h'um badzra p'a sha dr'i: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyi mkhrig ma mdud pa byas pa ni rdo rje zhags pa'o //
analyzed: h'um badzra p'a sha dr'i: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyi mkhrig ma mdud pa byas pa ni rdo rje zhags pa'o //
translated: The mantra is “Hūṃ vajra pāśa dṛṃ. ” The two vajra fists are crossed at the wrists. This is the vajra noose.

original: rdo rje ba dan gyis nub phyogs bcing bar bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje ba dan gyis nub phyogs bcing bar bya ste /
translated: With the vajra banner, one should bind the west.

original: aom badzra p'a tang gi p'a tang gi ni ra ta rdo rje bsdams pa'i mthe bong gnyis sems dpa'i skyil mo krung du byas la /
analyzed: aom badzra p'a tang gi p'a tang gi ni ra ta rdo rje bsdams pa'i mthe bong gnyis sems dpa'i skyil mo krung du byas la /
translated: The mantra is “Oṃ vajra pāṭala pāṭala nirghāta. ” The two thumbs of the vajra bond are in the sattva position,

original: mdzub mo gnyis mnyam nas srin lag phye ste /
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis mnyam nas srin lag phye ste /
translated: the two index fingers are even, the two ring fingers are spread,

original: mthe'u chung gnyis ba dan gyir tse mo ltar byas pa ni ba dan gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: mthe'u chung gnyis ba dan gyir tse mo ltar byas pa ni ba dan gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: and the two little fingers are like the tips of a banner. This is the banner mudrā.

original: de nas rdo rje nag mos byang phyogs bcing bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje nag mos byang phyogs bcing bar bya ste /
translated: Then, Vajra Black, having bound the northern direction,

original: aom hr'i: badzra k'a li ru ta ma ta rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi phyag rgya nyid snying gar bzhag la brtan par byas pa ni rdo re nag mo'i'o //
analyzed: aom hr'i: badzra k'a li ru ta ma ta rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi phyag rgya nyid snying gar bzhag la brtan par byas pa ni rdo re nag mo'i'o //
translated: with OM HRĪH VAJRA KĀLĪ RŪTA MAT, having placed the very mudra of Vajrayakṣa at the heart, one should stabilize it, which is the mudra of Vajra Black.

original: rdo rje rtse mos lho phyogs bcing bar bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje rtse mos lho phyogs bcing bar bya ste /
translated: Vajra Peak, having bound the southern direction,

original: aom badzra shi sha ra ru ta ma ta rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyis ri bo 'degs pa'i tshul du bya ba ni rdo rje rtse mo'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: aom badzra shi sha ra ru ta ma ta rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyis ri bo 'degs pa'i tshul du bya ba ni rdo rje rtse mo'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: with OM VAJRA ŚIKHARA RŪTA MAT, having made the mudra of Vajra Fist in the manner of lifting a mountain, one should stabilize it, which is the mudra of Vajra Peak.

original: rdo rje las kyi dkyil 'khor bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje las kyi dkyil 'khor bcing bar bya'o //
translated: One should bind the maṇḍala of Vajra Action.

original: h'um badzra karma yam h'um zhes bya ba rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi rab byas nas rdo rje bsdams pas rdo rje dra ba bya'o //
analyzed: h'um badzra karma yam h'um zhes bya ba rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi rab byas nas rdo rje bsdams pas rdo rje dra ba bya'o //
translated: With HŪM VAJRA KARMA YAṂ HŪM, having made the mudra of Vajra Hūṃkara, one should make a vajra net with the vajra binding.

original: sngags ni badzra bhandha bam /
analyzed: sngags ni badzra bhandha bam /
translated: The mantra is VAJRA BANDHA VAṂ.

original: de'i rjes la sgo dbye ba'i phyag rgyas sgo phye la /
analyzed: de'i rjes la sgo dbye ba'i phyag rgyas sgo phye la /
translated: After that, having opened the door with the mudra of opening the door,

original: rdo rje'i rgyu'i rang bzhin can gyi gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor zhal bzhi pa /
analyzed: rdo rje'i rgyu'i rang bzhin can gyi gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor zhal bzhi pa /
translated: one should enter the secret maṇḍala, which has the nature of the vajra cause, with four faces.

original: phyag bzhi pa badzra mandala h'um dza: zhes bya ba'i phyag rgya dang bcas pas dgug par bya'o //🔽rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyi mdzub mo dang mthe bong rdo rjer bya ba ni dkyil 'khor thams cad 'gugs pa'o ;
analyzed: phyag bzhi pa badzra mandala h'um dza: zhes bya ba'i phyag rgya dang bcas pas dgug par bya'o // rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyi mdzub mo dang mthe bong rdo rjer bya ba ni dkyil 'khor thams cad 'gugs pa'o ;
translated: One should summon with the four-part [mantra] and the gesture of Vajra Mandala, HUM JAH.🔽The gesture of Vajra Mandala is to make the vajra with the index finger and thumb of both vajra fists.

original: / rdo rje 'khor lo'i phyag rgya /
analyzed: / rdo rje 'khor lo'i phyag rgya /
translated: The gesture of Vajra Wheel is to make the wheel with the two vajra fists.

original: aom ma h'a badzra tsakra aa dhi tishtha siddha h'um zhes bya ba dang bcas pas dgug pa ni dkyil 'khor des byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: aom ma h'a badzra tsakra aa dhi tishtha siddha h'um zhes bya ba dang bcas pas dgug pa ni dkyil 'khor des byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: With the mantra OM GREAT VAJRA WHEEL ESTABLISHMENT SUCCESS HUM, one should summon and consecrate the mandala with that.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis 'khor lo bskor ba'i tshul gyis bskor ba ni 'di'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis 'khor lo bskor ba'i tshul gyis bskor ba ni 'di'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The gesture of that is to rotate the two vajra fists in the manner of turning a wheel.

original: de nas seng ldeng gi rdo rje phur bu yi ge h'um las mtha' yas dang rnam par rgyal ba dang / sprin sgra dang / gsus po che zhes bya /
analyzed: de nas seng ldeng gi rdo rje phur bu yi ge h'um las mtha' yas dang rnam par rgyal ba dang / sprin sgra dang / gsus po che zhes bya /
translated: Then, one should imagine the stakes of the vajra daggers of khadira wood, arisen from the syllable HUM, as limitless, victorious, cloud-sound, and great-bellied.

original: stod khro bo'i gzugs la smad rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i rnam par bsams la tsandan dmar po'i byug pas byugs shing /
analyzed: stod khro bo'i gzugs la smad rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i rnam par bsams la tsandan dmar po'i byug pas byugs shing /
translated: The upper part has the form of an angry being, and the lower part has the form of a single-pointed vajra. One should anoint with red sandalwood paste.

original: sras bu dmar pos bcing bar byas la /
analyzed: sras bu dmar pos bcing bar byas la /
translated: Bind the son with the red thread.

original: aom kro dha @86a * //
analyzed: aom kro dha @86a * //
translated: Recite the mantra “Oṃ krodha

original: tri ta ma ta zhes bya ba brgya rtsa brgyad zlos shing g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis bzung la /
analyzed: tri ta ma ta zhes bya ba brgya rtsa brgyad zlos shing g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis bzung la /
translated: tridaṇḍa” one hundred and eight times, holding it with the left vajra fist.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi grva bzhir rdo rjes brdung bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi grva bzhir rdo rjes brdung bar bya ba'am /
translated: With the vajra, one should strike the four corners of the maṇḍala.

original: g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis rdo rje rtse lnga pa blangs la /
analyzed: g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis rdo rje rtse lnga pa blangs la /
translated: Or, taking up the five-pronged vajra with the left vajra fist,

original: lag pa g-yas pa rdo rje rtse gsum pa lta bur byas pas dbang ldan gyi phyogs nas brtsams te /
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pa rdo rje rtse gsum pa lta bur byas pas dbang ldan gyi phyogs nas brtsams te /
translated: with the right hand in the form of a three-pronged vajra, beginning from the northeast corner,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi grva bzhir ji skad du bshad pa'i phur bu bzhi sngags 'dis skyed cing brdung par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi grva bzhir ji skad du bshad pa'i phur bu bzhi sngags 'dis skyed cing brdung par bya'o //
translated: one should generate and strike the four stakes as explained in the four corners of the maṇḍala with this mantra.

original: aom gha gha gh'a ta ya gh'a ta ya sarba du sht'am phat /🔽k'i la ya k'i la ya sarba p'a pam phat /
analyzed: aom gha gha gh'a ta ya gh'a ta ya sarba du sht'am phat / k'i la ya k'i la ya sarba p'a pam phat /
translated: Oṃ gha gha ghatāya ghatāya sarva duṣṭān phaṭ🔽Kill! Kill! all evil ones, phaṭ!

original: badzra k'i la ya badzra dha ro a'a dzny'a pa ya ti sv'a h'a ;
analyzed: badzra k'i la ya badzra dha ro a'a dzny'a pa ya ti sv'a h'a ;
translated: The vajra-holder’s command is obeyed, svāhā.

original: yang na aom badzra k'i li k'i l'a ya sarba bighn'am h'um phat /
analyzed: yang na aom badzra k'i li k'i l'a ya sarba bighn'am h'um phat /
translated: Or, oṃ vajra kīli kīlaya sarva vighnān hūṃ phaṭ.

original: ces bya ba phur bu bzhi la yongs su bzlas la 'di nyid zlos shing g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis bzung la g-yas pa'i 'bar ba'i rdo rjes brdung zhing dkyil 'khor gyi grva bzhir gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba phur bu bzhi la yongs su bzlas la 'di nyid zlos shing g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis bzung la g-yas pa'i 'bar ba'i rdo rjes brdung zhing dkyil 'khor gyi grva bzhir gdab par bya'o //
translated: Having recited this mantra over the four daggers, one should recite it while holding them with the left vajra fist and striking them with the blazing vajra of the right hand, and one should cast them into the four corners of the mandala.

original: de nas rdo rje gnod sbyin gyis bgegs bsal ba dang / ra ba dang dra ba yang byas la /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje gnod sbyin gyis bgegs bsal ba dang / ra ba dang dra ba yang byas la /
translated: Then, having expelled the obstructors with the vajra-yakṣa [mantra], one should also create the fence and the canopy.

original: dam tshig gi rdo rje khu tshur gyis sgo bcad de /
analyzed: dam tshig gi rdo rje khu tshur gyis sgo bcad de /
translated: Having closed the door with the pledge vajra fist,

original: rdo rje go cha'i phyag rgya aom trum zhes bya ba'i sngags dang bcas pas lha rnams dang bsrung ba thams cad yang dag par bsrungs nas /
analyzed: rdo rje go cha'i phyag rgya aom trum zhes bya ba'i sngags dang bcas pas lha rnams dang bsrung ba thams cad yang dag par bsrungs nas /
translated: and having protected all the deities and the protection wheel with the vajra-armor seal and the mantra oṃ trāṃ,🔽one should place the vase, which has been enchanted with the vajra-yakṣa [mantra], outside the door of the mandala house for the sake of sprinkling.

original: rdo rje gnod sbyin bzlas pa'i bum pas bsang gtor bya ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa'i sgor bzhag la rdo rje gnod sbyin zlos shing bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: rdo rje gnod sbyin bzlas pa'i bum pas bsang gtor bya ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa'i sgor bzhag la rdo rje gnod sbyin zlos shing bdag nyid dam /
translated: Reciting the vajra-yakṣa [mantra], either oneself or one’s assistant,

original: grogs dang bcas pas dkyil 'khor gyi shar nas brtsams te byug par bya'o //
analyzed: grogs dang bcas pas dkyil 'khor gyi shar nas brtsams te byug par bya'o //
translated: should anoint the mandala, beginning in the east.

original: de nas slob dpon gyis bdag po lnga'i gnas su tsandan dang gur gum la sogs pas dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa bya /
analyzed: de nas slob dpon gyis bdag po lnga'i gnas su tsandan dang gur gum la sogs pas dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa bya /
translated: Then, the master should make a square mandala with sandalwood, saffron, etc., in the places of the five lords.

original: lha lhag ma rnams kyi gnas su ni dkyil 'khor zlum por bya zhing rang rang gi sngags lan bdun bdun bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: lha lhag ma rnams kyi gnas su ni dkyil 'khor zlum por bya zhing rang rang gi sngags lan bdun bdun bzlas par bya'o //
translated: In the places of the remaining deities, he should make a circular mandala and recite each mantra seven times.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'dug la yid kyis dkyil 'khor thams cad yongs su brtag par byas nas nam mkha'i phyogs nas de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du byas la gur gum la sogs pa'i thig le de rnams su rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rang rang gi sngags kyis bzhugs su gsol la mchod pa rnam pa lngas yang dag par mchod par bya'o//
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'dug la yid kyis dkyil 'khor thams cad yongs su brtag par byas nas nam mkha'i phyogs nas de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du byas la gur gum la sogs pa'i thig le de rnams su rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rang rang gi sngags kyis bzhugs su gsol la mchod pa rnam pa lngas yang dag par mchod par bya'o//
translated: Then, sitting in the middle of the mandala, having mentally examined the entire mandala, he should summon, induct, bind, and control the Tathāgatas, etc., from the sky region, and having invited them with the mantra of each of Vairocana, etc., into those drops of saffron, etc., he should make offerings with the five offerings.

original: @86b de nas phyi rol du gtor ma byin la nye reg byas nas /
analyzed: @86b de nas phyi rol du gtor ma byin la nye reg byas nas /
translated: Then, having given the bali outside and performed the self-protection,

original: mchod yon la mchod yon gyi phyag rgya dang / yi ge h'um brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas nas /
analyzed: mchod yon la mchod yon gyi phyag rgya dang / yi ge h'um brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas nas /
translated: For water for the feet, make the mudra for water for the feet and recite the syllable hum one hundred and eight times.🔽

original: 'di skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i bum par spos chu cung zad blugs la /
analyzed: 'di skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i bum par spos chu cung zad blugs la /
translated: For the water for the feet, one should recite the mantra of Vajrayakṣa one hundred and eight times, and then say, “Having placed a little incense water in a vase that has the characteristics as explained,

original: h'um las rdo rje gnod sbyin bskyed de /
analyzed: h'um las rdo rje gnod sbyin bskyed de /
translated: one should generate Vajrayakṣa from the letter hūṃ.

original: rang gi phyag rgya bzhis rgyas btab la dbang bskur ba'i phyag rgyas dbang bskur nas /
analyzed: rang gi phyag rgya bzhis rgyas btab la dbang bskur ba'i phyag rgyas dbang bskur nas /
translated: Having sealed it with one’s four seals, one should confer empowerment with the empowerment seal.

original: mchod yon phul nas mchod pa rnam pa lnga dang / sgeg mo la sogs pa'i phyag rgya rnams kyis kyang yang dag par mchod nas /
analyzed: mchod yon phul nas mchod pa rnam pa lnga dang / sgeg mo la sogs pa'i phyag rgya rnams kyis kyang yang dag par mchod nas /
translated: Having offered the water for the feet, one should also make offerings with the five offerings and with the seals of the goddesses such as Charmī.

original: rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi phyag rgyas yongs su bzung ba'i rdo rje dang me tog gi lcug ma las aom badzra yaksha h'um zhes brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas nas me tog gis sil mar gtor nas spos kyang gtul bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi phyag rgyas yongs su bzung ba'i rdo rje dang me tog gi lcug ma las aom badzra yaksha h'um zhes brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas nas me tog gis sil mar gtor nas spos kyang gtul bar bya'o //
translated: Having completely made offerings, one should hold the flower and vajra with the seal of Vajrayakṣa, and recite oṃ vajra-yakṣa hūṃ one hundred and eight times. Having scattered the flowers, one should also burn incense.

original: de bzhin du rdo rje me dang rdo rje h'um mdzad gnyis yongs su bzlas pa'i bdug spos dbul bar bya zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du rdo rje me dang rdo rje h'um mdzad gnyis yongs su bzlas pa'i bdug spos dbul bar bya zhing /
translated: Likewise, one should offer incense completely suffused with the two, Vajra Fire and Vajra Humkara.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi zhag ni thun gsum du bzla'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi zhag ni thun gsum du bzla'o //
translated: One should recite the maṇḍala three times a day.

original: de nas rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi spyan sngar gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi spyan sngar gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should place it in front of Vajra Humkara.

original: bum pa lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: bum pa lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the rite of the consecration of the vase.

original: de nas rdo rje gnod sbyin dang / rdo rje me dang / rdo rje h'um mdzad dang / m'a ma k'i la re re zhing mar la sogs pa'i rdzas las brgya rtsa brgyad dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje gnod sbyin dang / rdo rje me dang / rdo rje h'um mdzad dang / m'a ma k'i la re re zhing mar la sogs pa'i rdzas las brgya rtsa brgyad dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Then, one should offer one hundred and eight oblations of ghee and so forth with each of Vajra Yaka, Vajra Fire, Vajra Humkara, and Mamaki.

original: lhag par gnas pa'i sbyin sreg gi cho ga'o //
analyzed: lhag par gnas pa'i sbyin sreg gi cho ga'o //
translated: This is the rite of the consecration fire offering.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa la mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pas bstod de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa la mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pas bstod de /
translated: Then, one should praise the Blessed One together with the retinue with the one hundred and eight names.🔽One should also make offerings with the eight offerings beginning with the lovely lady, and with flowers and so forth.

original: sgeg mo la sogs pa'i mchod pa brgyad dang / me tog la sogs pas kyang yang dag par mchod la phyag byas nas mchod yon phul la /
analyzed: sgeg mo la sogs pa'i mchod pa brgyad dang / me tog la sogs pas kyang yang dag par mchod la phyag byas nas mchod yon phul la /
translated: Having made prostrations, one should offer a welcoming drink.

original: slob ma lhag par gas par bya'o //
analyzed: slob ma lhag par gas par bya'o //
translated: One should consecrate the disciples.

original: de la re zhig dang por legs par khrus byas la /
analyzed: de la re zhig dang por legs par khrus byas la /
translated: First, having bathed well,

original: gos gtsang ma bgos shing lag par me tog thogs pa'i slob mas /
analyzed: gos gtsang ma bgos shing lag par me tog thogs pa'i slob mas /
translated: the disciple, wearing clean clothes and holding flowers in his hands,

original: slob dpon la phyag byas la 'di skad ces brjod du gzhug go //
analyzed: slob dpon la phyag byas la 'di skad ces brjod du gzhug go //
translated: having bowed to the master, should be made to say this:

original: dga' chen khyod bdag ston pa bas //
analyzed: dga' chen khyod bdag ston pa bas //
translated: “Greatly joyful one, you are my teacher;

original: slob dpon khyod ni dgongs su gsol //🔽byang chub chen pos tshul brtan pa //
analyzed: slob dpon khyod ni dgongs su gsol // byang chub chen pos tshul brtan pa //
translated: you, master, please consider me.🔽I seek the great protector,

original: mgon po chen po bdag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: mgon po chen po bdag 'tshal lo //
translated: firm in the way of great enlightenment.

original: dam tshig de nyid stsal du gsol //
analyzed: dam tshig de nyid stsal du gsol //
translated: Please grant me the reality of the commitments;

original: byang chub sems kyang stsal du gsol //🔽sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun te //
analyzed: byang chub sems kyang stsal du gsol // sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun te //
translated: please grant me the thought of enlightenment.

original: skyabs gsum dag kyang stsal du gsol //🔽thar pa chen pos grong mchog tu //
analyzed: skyabs gsum dag kyang stsal du gsol // thar pa chen pos grong mchog tu //
translated: Please grant me the three refuges:🔽the Buddha, the teaching, and the community.🔽I, protector, will enter

original: mgon po bdag ni 'jug par bgyi //🔽de nas slob @87a * //
analyzed: mgon po bdag ni 'jug par bgyi // de nas slob @87a * //
translated: the supreme city of great liberation.”

original: dpon gyis slob ma'i snying gar h'um las rdo rje bskyed la /
analyzed: dpon gyis slob ma'i snying gar h'um las rdo rje bskyed la /
translated: Then the master, having generated a vajra from hūṃ in the disciple’s heart,

original: khu tshur g-yas pas rdo rje bzung ste /
analyzed: khu tshur g-yas pas rdo rje bzung ste /
translated: holding the vajra with the right fist,

original: snying po de'i snying gar gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: snying po de'i snying gar gzhag par bya'o //
translated: should place it on his heart.

original: su ra ta sa ma ya stvam ho siddhi badzra ya th'a su kha zhes bya ba brjod nas de nas sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa byed du gzhug par bya ste /
analyzed: su ra ta sa ma ya stvam ho siddhi badzra ya th'a su kha zhes bya ba brjod nas de nas sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa byed du gzhug par bya ste /
translated: Then, having uttered the words Surasa mayasattvam hoḥ siddhi vajra yathā sukha, one should cause [the disciple] to confess his sins and so forth.

original: rtog pa ma lus legs par bsdus nas ni //
analyzed: rtog pa ma lus legs par bsdus nas ni //
translated: Having well gathered all thoughts,

original: shin tu bsam pa bzang po ldan pas gson //
analyzed: shin tu bsam pa bzang po ldan pas gson //
translated: listen with a very good intention.🔽 The Sugatas will not bless those

original: brjod pas blo la rdo rje sems sogs pa'i //🔽bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyis byin mi rlob //
analyzed: brjod pas blo la rdo rje sems sogs pa'i // bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyis byin mi rlob //
translated: whose minds are not vajra-minded and so forth.🔽 Whatever non-virtue I have done without control,

original: dbang med bdag gis mi dge bgyis pa dang // rjes su yi rang yang na bgyid stsal gang //🔽de dag thams cad byang chub mchog gi ni //
analyzed: dbang med bdag gis mi dge bgyis pa dang // rjes su yi rang yang na bgyid stsal gang // de dag thams cad byang chub mchog gi ni //
translated: or whatever I have rejoiced in,🔽I confess all of that individually

original: spyan sngar ma lus so sor bshags par bgyi //🔽bde gshegs sras kyi tshogs gnyis zab pa dang // rgya chen 'gro ba ma lus pa yi don //
analyzed: spyan sngar ma lus so sor bshags par bgyi // bde gshegs sras kyi tshogs gnyis zab pa dang // rgya chen 'gro ba ma lus pa yi don //
translated: in the presence of the supreme enlightenment.🔽 The assembly of Bodhisattvas, the two accumulations, the profound,

original: sgrub par byed dang de las gzhan pa la'ang /
analyzed: sgrub par byed dang de las gzhan pa la'ang /
translated: and the vast, accomplish the purpose of all beings without exception.

original: rtag tu bdag ni rjes su yi rang ngo //
analyzed: rtag tu bdag ni rjes su yi rang ngo //
translated: I constantly rejoice in that,🔽and also in what is other than that.

original: thugs rjes khyab pa'i thugs dang ldan gyur cing //
analyzed: thugs rjes khyab pa'i thugs dang ldan gyur cing //
translated: May those who have the intention pervaded by compassion,🔽 and those who have the intention of great love,

original: blo gros sdig bral gti mug tshogs kun bcom //
analyzed: blo gros sdig bral gti mug tshogs kun bcom //
translated: I take refuge in the Sugatas,🔽who dwell in the lotus of the family,

original: ma lus rigs kyi padma'i nang bzhugs pa //
analyzed: ma lus rigs kyi padma'i nang bzhugs pa //
translated: having destroyed the darkness of ignorance and the host of sins.

original: bde bar gshegs pa rnams la skyabs su mchi //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa rnams la skyabs su mchi //
translated: I take refuge in the Dharma, the supreme speech,

original: blo mchog rnams kyi kun dga' rab ste //🔽dman pa'i 'jigs pa nyid kyi rgyal byed tshal //
analyzed: blo mchog rnams kyi kun dga' rab ste // dman pa'i 'jigs pa nyid kyi rgyal byed tshal //
translated: the delightful garden of the best of minds,🔽the Jetavana of the Victorious Ones,🔽the supreme vanquisher of the wealth of existence.

original: srid pa'i 'byor pa zil gyis gnon pa'i mchog / gsung mchog chos la bdag ni skyabs su mchi //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'byor pa zil gyis gnon pa'i mchog / gsung mchog chos la bdag ni skyabs su mchi //
translated: I take refuge in the Sangha, the assembly of those of good conduct,

original: 'dod chags la sogs sprul gyi dug bcom zhing //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs sprul gyi dug bcom zhing //
translated: who have conquered the poison of the snake of desire and so forth,

original: blo gros rnam rgyal thugs rje cher ldan pa'i //🔽brtul zhugs bzang po'i tshogs la skyabs su mchi //
analyzed: blo gros rnam rgyal thugs rje cher ldan pa'i // brtul zhugs bzang po'i tshogs la skyabs su mchi //
translated: who are endowed with great compassion and the victory over the mind.

original: srid dang bral ba rnams la bdag phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: srid dang bral ba rnams la bdag phyag 'tshal //
translated: I pay homage to those who are free from existence.

original: rgyu yi rjes la bdag po'i yul bdag nyid //
analyzed: rgyu yi rjes la bdag po'i yul bdag nyid //
translated: The cause, the lord, the object, and the self,

original: 'bras bu'i stobs kyis dgra las rgyal gyur pa //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i stobs kyis dgra las rgyal gyur pa //
translated: having conquered the enemy through the power of the result,

original: snying rje'i rtsa pa zug cing yang dag rtogs //
analyzed: snying rje'i rtsa pa zug cing yang dag rtogs //
translated: with the root of compassion, and right understanding,

original: mnyam med byang chub rnam gsum gzung bar bgyi //
analyzed: mnyam med byang chub rnam gsum gzung bar bgyi //
translated: I uphold the incomparable enlightenment in three aspects.

original: sems can rnams ni yongs su smin pa'am //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni yongs su smin pa'am //
translated: In order to ripen sentient beings,

original: yang na yongs su bskyab par bya phyir ram //
analyzed: yang na yongs su bskyab par bya phyir ram //
translated: or to protect them,

original: rang gi sems ni dag par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rang gi sems ni dag par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: or to purify my own mind,

original: 'di dag thams cad rtsva sogs bzhin du btang //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad rtsva sogs bzhin du btang //
translated: I will give up everything, as if it were mere grass.🔽Likewise, I will cultivate, in every moment,🔽immeasurable discipline, patience, diligence,

original: de bzhin tshul khrims bzod dang brtson 'grus dang // bsam gtan shes rab bla na @87b med pa ni //
analyzed: de bzhin tshul khrims bzod dang brtson 'grus dang // bsam gtan shes rab bla na @87b med pa ni //
translated: meditative concentration, and wisdom,

original: bdag dang gzhan rnams dag par bya ba'i phyir //🔽skad cig re re zhing yang bsgom par bgyi //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan rnams dag par bya ba'i phyir // skad cig re re zhing yang bsgom par bgyi //
translated: in order to purify myself and others.🔽I will abide in the exalted state🔽in order to attain the state of the Sugata,

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i sngags la mkhas pa yi //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i sngags la mkhas pa yi //
translated: who is skilled in the mantra,

original: chos rgyal rtag tu lhun gyis grub pa ni //🔽'gro ba 'di yis thob par bya ba'i phyir //🔽khyad 'phags gnas la bdag ni gnas par bgyi //🔽zhes bya ba lan gsum brjod do //
analyzed: chos rgyal rtag tu lhun gyis grub pa ni // 'gro ba 'di yis thob par bya ba'i phyir // khyad 'phags gnas la bdag ni gnas par bgyi // zhes bya ba lan gsum brjod do //
translated: the spontaneously present Dharma King.

original: bdag ni de skad ces brjod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis /
analyzed: bdag ni de skad ces brjod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis /
translated: By this root of virtue,

original: bdag gis log pa'i bsam pa thams cad yongs su gtang bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag gis log pa'i bsam pa thams cad yongs su gtang bar bgyi'o //
translated: I will give up all wrong thoughts.

original: bdag gis sems can thams cad la snyoms pa'i sems bskyed par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can thams cad la snyoms pa'i sems bskyed par bgyi'o //
translated: I will arouse the thought of sameness toward all sentient beings.

original: bdag gis sems can thams cad theg pa thams cad dang / thabs kyi bye brag thams cad kyis btul nas /
analyzed: bdag gis sems can thams cad theg pa thams cad dang / thabs kyi bye brag thams cad kyis btul nas /
translated: Having trained all sentient beings in all vehicles and all specific methods,

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la rab tu gzhag par bgyi'o //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la rab tu gzhag par bgyi'o //
translated: I will establish them in the realm of non-abiding nirvana.

original: bdag gis sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur kyang /
analyzed: bdag gis sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur kyang /
translated: Even though I will have brought all sentient beings to complete nirvana,

original: sems can 'ga' yang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa med do zhes sems bskyed par bgyi'o //
analyzed: sems can 'ga' yang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa med do zhes sems bskyed par bgyi'o //
translated: I will arouse the thought that not a single sentient being has attained complete nirvana.

original: bdag gis chos thams cad skye ba med pa nyid du rjes su rtogs par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag gis chos thams cad skye ba med pa nyid du rjes su rtogs par bgyi'o //
translated: I will realize that all phenomena are unborn.

original: bdag gis ma yengs pa'i sems dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi sems kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag gis ma yengs pa'i sems dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi sems kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: With an undistracted mind and the mind of omniscience, I will train in the six perfections.

original: bdag gis theg pa gcig gi tshul du gnas par yang rtogs par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag gis theg pa gcig gi tshul du gnas par yang rtogs par bgyi'o //
translated: I will realize the way of abiding in the single vehicle.

original: bdag gis byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la gnas pa'i so sor rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bslab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag gis byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la gnas pa'i so sor rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bslab par bgyi'o //
translated: I should train in order to realize the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: bdag ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams so sor rtogs par bya ba'i phyir mngon par brtson par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams so sor rtogs par bya ba'i phyir mngon par brtson par bgyi'o //
translated: I should strive to realize the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de bzhin du bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi chos tshad med pa ma lus pa'i bar la mngon par gnas par bya ba'i phyir mngon par bsgrub par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi chos tshad med pa ma lus pa'i bar la mngon par gnas par bya ba'i phyir mngon par bsgrub par bgyi'o //
translated: In the same way, I should accomplish all the limitless qualities of a buddha, up to and including the unshared qualities of a buddha.

original: 'di nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byang chub chen por sems bskyed pa rdo rje lta bu yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byang chub chen por sems bskyed pa rdo rje lta bu yin te /
translated: This is the vajra-like generation of the thought of awakening of the bodhisattvas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yab dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bka' bzhin byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sras kyi thu bo @88a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yab dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bka' bzhin byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sras kyi thu bo @88a * //
translated: He is the father of all the Tathāgatas, the doer of the bidding of all the Tathāgatas, the eldest son of all the Tathāgatas.

original: ste ; 'di nyid ni bcom ldan 'das dpal kun du bzang po'o //
analyzed: ste ; 'di nyid ni bcom ldan 'das dpal kun du bzang po'o //
translated: He is the Blessed One, the glorious Samantabhadra.

original: de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par rdzogs par byas pa'i stobs kyis bdag sems bskyed pa 'di la gnas pas kun du bzang po'i spyod pa zhes bya ba sgo mtha' yas pa la gnas pa mtha' med par gyur pa rdzogs
analyzed: de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par rdzogs par byas pa'i stobs kyis bdag sems bskyed pa 'di la gnas pas kun du bzang po'i spyod pa zhes bya ba sgo mtha' yas pa la gnas pa mtha' med par gyur pa rdzogs
translated: By the power of his roots of virtue, which are perfectly complete, I, abiding in this generation of the thought of enlightenment, will, having completed the practice called “the conduct of Samantabhadra,” which has an infinite number of doors and is infinite in extent,

original: par byas nas gdul bya'i 'gro ba'i tshogs ma lus pa rnams la spyod pa'i rab tu dbye ba'i sgo mang po bstan pas yang dag par mgu bar bya ba dang / yang dag par dga' bar bya ba dang / yang dag par gzengs bstod pa la nges par sbyar bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: par byas nas gdul bya'i 'gro ba'i tshogs ma lus pa rnams la spyod pa'i rab tu dbye ba'i sgo mang po bstan pas yang dag par mgu bar bya ba dang / yang dag par dga' bar bya ba dang / yang dag par gzengs bstod pa la nges par sbyar bar bgyi'o //
translated: having taught many doors of the divisions of conduct to the entire multitude of beings to be trained, will certainly engage in the work of pleasing, delighting, and encouraging them.

original: sngom pa don du gnyer ba la bslab pa'i gzhi lnga 'dzin du gzhug go //
analyzed: sngom pa don du gnyer ba la bslab pa'i gzhi lnga 'dzin du gzhug go //
translated: To those who seek the vows, one should cause them to take up the five basic precepts.

original: de nas slob ma'i lag tu rdo rje dris dri /
analyzed: de nas slob ma'i lag tu rdo rje dris dri /
translated: Then, having asked the disciple to hold a vajra in his hand,

original: me tog gis me tog sbyin zhing bdug pas kyang slob ma yang dag par bdugs la /
analyzed: me tog gis me tog sbyin zhing bdug pas kyang slob ma yang dag par bdugs la /
translated: having given him a flower, and having fumigated the disciple with incense,

original: mar me mas mar mas snang bar bya'o //
analyzed: mar me mas mar mas snang bar bya'o //
translated: he should be illuminated with a lamp.🔽Then, having given him a tooth stick of udumbara or asvattha wood, together with incense, flowers, and so forth, one should give him the tooth stick, having recited the Wrathful Vajra Laughter.

original: de nas au dum b'a ra'am aa shvadtha'i so shing spos dang / me tog la sogs pa dang ldan pa la khro bo rdo rje bzhad pa bzlas pa dang / ku sha sar pa ma nyams pa la khro bo rdo rje rnon po bzlas la de la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas au dum b'a ra'am aa shvadtha'i so shing spos dang / me tog la sogs pa dang ldan pa la khro bo rdo rje bzhad pa bzlas pa dang / ku sha sar pa ma nyams pa la khro bo rdo rje rnon po bzlas la de la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Having given him fresh, undamaged kuśa grass, one should give him the grass, having recited the Wrathful Vajra Sharpness.

original: de nas khro bo rdo rje srung ba bzlas pa'i srung skud mdud pa gsum dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de nas khro bo rdo rje srung ba bzlas pa'i srung skud mdud pa gsum dang ldan pa /
translated: Then, having tied a protection cord, having recited the Wrathful Vajra Protection, with three knots,

original: de'i dpung pa g-yon par bdag nyid kyis bcing bar bya zhing /
analyzed: de'i dpung pa g-yon par bdag nyid kyis bcing bar bya zhing /
translated: one should tie it on his left upper arm.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i gtsug tor gyis yang dag par bsrung ba dang / byams pa'i go cha bskon la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i gtsug tor gyis yang dag par bsrung ba dang / byams pa'i go cha bskon la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: Then, having protected with the crest of Vajrasattva and having put on the armor of Maitreya, one should say this:

original: bzhin bzangs longs la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phyag byos shig / nang par dkyil 'khor chen po mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhin bzangs longs la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phyag byos shig / nang par dkyil 'khor chen po mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “O handsome one, come and pay homage to all the Tathagatas, and in the morning you will see the great mandala.”

original: de nas nyi ma 'char ka'i dus su lha thams cad de bzhin du bar snang la bzhag ste /
analyzed: de nas nyi ma 'char ka'i dus su lha thams cad de bzhin du bar snang la bzhag ste /
translated: Then, at sunrise, having placed all the deities in the sky in the same way,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi gnas spos chus byugs la me tog la sogs pas kyang mdzes par byas nas /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi gnas spos chus byugs la me tog la sogs pas kyang mdzes par byas nas /
translated: one should anoint the site of the mandala with scented water and make it beautiful with flowers and so forth.

original: tshon sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / ljang gu dang / dkar po dri zhim pos bsgos pas srad bu so sor kha bsgyur la go rims 'di nyid kyis bzhag nas h'um tr'a hr'i: aa a'a zhes bya ba rang gi sa bon 'di las byung ba'i thig gi 'od zer gyis mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rang rang gi
analyzed: tshon sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / ljang gu dang / dkar po dri zhim pos bsgos pas srad bu so sor kha bsgyur la go rims 'di nyid kyis bzhag nas h'um tr'a hr'i: aa a'a zhes bya ba rang gi sa bon 'di las byung ba'i thig gi 'od zer gyis mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rang rang gi
translated: Having dyed the threads blue, yellow, red, green, and white with fragrant colors, having arranged them in order, and having placed them with the light rays of the thread that arises from one’s seed syllable, HŪṃ, TRe, HṚiḥ, A, and Ā, one should summon Akṣobhya and so forth with their retinue to the individual directions with the mantra of summoning.

original: phyogs na bzhugs par yang dag par btang @88b ba dang ; 'bar ba'i lcags kyus drangs te rang gi lag na gnas pa'i srad bu legs par dgang bar bya zhing /
analyzed: phyogs na bzhugs par yang dag par btang @88b ba dang ; 'bar ba'i lcags kyus drangs te rang gi lag na gnas pa'i srad bu legs par dgang bar bya zhing /
translated: Having imagined that they are situated in the directions, one should draw them with a blazing hook, and having drawn them, one should fill the thread that is in one's hand.

original: aom aa n+yo n+ya aa nu ga ta sarba dharm'a: spha ra spha ra aa nu pra bishta sarba dharm'a: aa tyanta aa nu pra bishta sarba dharm'a h'um zhes zlos shing bsgril bar bya'o //
analyzed: aom aa n+yo n+ya aa nu ga ta sarba dharm'a: spha ra spha ra aa nu pra bishta sarba dharm'a: aa tyanta aa nu pra bishta sarba dharm'a h'um zhes zlos shing bsgril bar bya'o //
translated: Reciting Om anyonya-anugata sarva-dharmas, sphara sphara anupravistha sarva-dharmas, atyanta-anupravistha sarva-dharmas hum, one should twist the thread.

original: de nas srad bu de tsandan bzang po la sogs pas byugs pa'i gser gyi snod la sogs par bzhag la /🔽me tog gis mchod de rdo rje bsdams pas bzung la thig gdab pa'i sngags lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas srad bu de tsandan bzang po la sogs pas byugs pa'i gser gyi snod la sogs par bzhag la / me tog gis mchod de rdo rje bsdams pas bzung la thig gdab pa'i sngags lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, having placed that thread in a golden vessel, etc., anointed with good sandalwood, etc.,🔽having worshipped it with flowers, one should hold it with the vajra-binding, and recite the mantra for laying out the lines one hundred and eight times.

original: de nas rdo rje h'um mdzad la sogs pa bdag po rnams kyi sngags kyang brgya rtsa brgyad bzla bar bya'o ;
analyzed: de nas rdo rje h'um mdzad la sogs pa bdag po rnams kyi sngags kyang brgya rtsa brgyad bzla bar bya'o ;
translated: Then one should recite the mantras of the lords, such as Vajra Humkara, one hundred and eight times.

original: / de nas yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod la phyag byas nas langs te yid kyis rnam par snang mdzad du gyur nas /
analyzed: / de nas yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod la phyag byas nas langs te yid kyis rnam par snang mdzad du gyur nas /
translated: Then, having made offerings to all the tathāgatas and bowed down, one should rise up, and mentally become Vairocana.

original: phyag na rdo rje'i thugs ka nas rdo rje'i grogs mchog h'um zhes bya ba 'dis khro bo'i rdo rje las kyi gzugs su dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje'i thugs ka nas rdo rje'i grogs mchog h'um zhes bya ba 'dis khro bo'i rdo rje las kyi gzugs su dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: From Vajrapāṇi’s heart, the vajra friend supreme, the syllable hūṃ, should be emitted in the form of the wrathful Vajrakarma.

original: yang de nyid rdo rje h'um mdzad du gyur pa la mig g-yas dang g-yon gnyis su yi ge dza las zla ba dang nyi ma ser po snang ba bskyed la /
analyzed: yang de nyid rdo rje h'um mdzad du gyur pa la mig g-yas dang g-yon gnyis su yi ge dza las zla ba dang nyi ma ser po snang ba bskyed la /
translated: Again, that [syllable] becomes Vajrahūṃkāra, and in the right and left eyes one should generate the appearance of the yellow moon and sun from the syllable ja.

original: dza zhes bya bas sgrub pa'i grogs mchog gi lag du srad bu de btang la /
analyzed: dza zhes bya bas sgrub pa'i grogs mchog gi lag du srad bu de btang la /
translated: With the syllable ja, one should give the thread to the friend supreme in the practice.

original: srad bu dang po g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis bzung la phyis ni ci bder bya zhing phyogs thams cad mnyam pa nyid du bsam mo //
analyzed: srad bu dang po g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis bzung la phyis ni ci bder bya zhing phyogs thams cad mnyam pa nyid du bsam mo //
translated: The first thread should be held with the left vajra fist, and later one should do whatever is comfortable, and one should imagine that all directions are the same.

original: phyogs kun mnyam pa nyid dmigs la //
analyzed: phyogs kun mnyam pa nyid dmigs la //
translated: Having visualized that all directions are the same,

original: mkhas pas dkyil 'khor thig gdab ste //
analyzed: mkhas pas dkyil 'khor thig gdab ste //
translated: the wise one should lay out the lines of the maṇḍala.

original: shar dang nub dang byang dang lhor //
analyzed: shar dang nub dang byang dang lhor //
translated: In the east, west, north and south,

original: thig bzhi btab pas dkyil 'khor brgyad //
analyzed: thig bzhi btab pas dkyil 'khor brgyad //
translated: by placing four lines, there are eight mandalas.

original: aom badzra s'u tra m'a ti kra ma h'um zhes bya ba 'di dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sems can gyi don gyi phyir 'dir gshegs su gsol zhes bskul bar bya'o //🔽grva bzhir bya zhing sgo bzhir gdod //
analyzed: aom badzra s'u tra m'a ti kra ma h'um zhes bya ba 'di dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sems can gyi don gyi phyir 'dir gshegs su gsol zhes bskul bar bya'o // grva bzhir bya zhing sgo bzhir gdod //
translated: One should summon the Tathagatas dwelling in all the Buddha-fields, saying: Come here for the sake of sentient beings!🔽 In the four corners, one should make four doors.

original: rta babs bzhis kyang rab tu brgyan //
analyzed: rta babs bzhis kyang rab tu brgyan //
translated: It is adorned with four archways.

original: srad bu bzhi dang ldan pa ste //
analyzed: srad bu bzhi dang ldan pa ste //
translated: It has four lines,

original: dar dang phreng bas shin tu brgyan //
analyzed: dar dang phreng bas shin tu brgyan //
translated: and is well adorned with silk and garlands.

original: zla ba phyed par rab gnas pa'i //
analyzed: zla ba phyed par rab gnas pa'i //
translated: It is well-arranged with half-moons,🔽surrounded by a courtyard,

original: khyams kyis yongs su bskor ba dang // dra ba dra phyed dag gis spras //
analyzed: khyams kyis yongs su bskor ba dang // dra ba dra phyed dag gis spras //
translated: adorned with nets and half-nets,

original: sgo rnams dang ni rgyan cha can //
analyzed: sgo rnams dang ni rgyan cha can //
translated: with doors and ornaments,🔽with various supreme wind-activities,

original: rlung gis spyod pa sna tshogs mchog / ba dan dril bu sgra sgrogs pa //
analyzed: rlung gis spyod pa sna tshogs mchog / ba dan dril bu sgra sgrogs pa //
translated: with banners and ringing bells.

original: khyams ni med par gyur pa'i sgo //
analyzed: khyams ni med par gyur pa'i sgo //
translated: The courtyard becomes a door.

original: me tog @89a * //
analyzed: me tog @89a * //
translated: Flowers

original: chun 'phyang rgyan gyis bskor //
analyzed: chun 'phyang rgyan gyis bskor //
translated: It is surrounded by a garland of tassels.🔽In the corners of all the maṇḍalas

original: dkyil 'khor kun gyi grva rnams dang // sgo khyud kyi ni mtshams rnams su //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor kun gyi grva rnams dang // sgo khyud kyi ni mtshams rnams su //
translated: and in the intermediate directions of the gateways,

original: rdo rje rin chen brgyan par ni //
analyzed: rdo rje rin chen brgyan par ni //
translated: adorned with vajra jewels,

original: dkyil 'khor phyi rim srad bu bre //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor phyi rim srad bu bre //
translated: the outer maṇḍala is measured with a string.

original: shes rab can gyis de nang du //
analyzed: shes rab can gyis de nang du //
translated: The wise one,

original: rdo rje rin chen gyis brgyan te //
analyzed: rdo rje rin chen gyis brgyan te //
translated: adorned with vajra jewels,

original: gru bzhi pa la sgo bzhi pa //
analyzed: gru bzhi pa la sgo bzhi pa //
translated: with four corners, four gates,

original: ka ba brgyad dang rta babs bcas //
analyzed: ka ba brgyad dang rta babs bcas //
translated: eight pillars, and archways,

original: rdo rje ka ba'i nang logs su //
analyzed: rdo rje ka ba'i nang logs su //
translated: inside the vajra pillars,

original: dkyil 'khor lnga yis brgyan pa ste //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor lnga yis brgyan pa ste //
translated: adorned with five maṇḍalas,

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor srad bu bre //
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor srad bu bre //
translated: in that way, the maṇḍala is measured with a string.

original: srad bu bres pa tshon gyis dgang //
analyzed: srad bu bres pa tshon gyis dgang //
translated: The measured string is filled with colors.

original: lhag ma ni phyi'i dkyil 'khor yin par blta'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni phyi'i dkyil 'khor yin par blta'o //
translated: The remainder is seen as the outer maṇḍala.

original: gal te bgegs zlog par byed 'dod par gyur na seng ldeng gi phur bu stod rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i rnam pa la /
analyzed: gal te bgegs zlog par byed 'dod par gyur na seng ldeng gi phur bu stod rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i rnam pa la /
translated: If one wishes to avert obstructors, a khaṭvāṅga staff is placed in each of the four directions.

original: smad rdo rje rtse gcig pa lta bu la snga ma bzhin du rdo rje phur bu'i sngags bzlas te dkyil 'khor gyi lte bar rdo rjes brdung bar bya'o //
analyzed: smad rdo rje rtse gcig pa lta bu la snga ma bzhin du rdo rje phur bu'i sngags bzlas te dkyil 'khor gyi lte bar rdo rjes brdung bar bya'o //
translated: As before, one should recite the Vajra Dagger mantra, and with the vajra one should strike the center of the maṇḍala like the lower single-pronged vajra.

original: yang dkyil 'khor gyi lte ba'i dbus su sngar bstan pa'i phur bu dang 'dra ba'i phur bu gzhan dag la phur bu'i sngags lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pas go rims 'di bzhin du bgegs thams cad la phur bus gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dkyil 'khor gyi lte ba'i dbus su sngar bstan pa'i phur bu dang 'dra ba'i phur bu gzhan dag la phur bu'i sngags lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pas go rims 'di bzhin du bgegs thams cad la phur bus gdab par bya'o //
translated: Again, in the center of the maṇḍala, with another dagger like the one previously shown, one should recite the dagger mantra one hundred and eight times. With this sequence, one should strike all the obstructors with the dagger.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi lte ba la btags pa'i srad bus bskor phyogs su /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi lte ba la btags pa'i srad bus bskor phyogs su /
translated: With the thread tied to the center of the maṇḍala as explained, one should draw a circle to the right.

original: phyi'i dkyil 'khor zlum po dang / 'od kyi dkyil 'khor thig gdab pa'i yang phyi rol du /
analyzed: phyi'i dkyil 'khor zlum po dang / 'od kyi dkyil 'khor thig gdab pa'i yang phyi rol du /
translated: Outside of the circle of light of the outer maṇḍala,

original: de bzhin du 'khor yug chen por zlum por thig legs par gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khor yug chen por zlum por thig legs par gdab par bya'o //
translated: one should also draw a circle around the great enclosure.

original: 'od kyi dkyil 'khor der grog mkhar gyi sa la sogs pas bgegs kyi gzugs brnyan byas nas brgya byin gyi gzugs brnyan rang gi phyogs na gnas pa la ai las brgya byin ser po /
analyzed: 'od kyi dkyil 'khor der grog mkhar gyi sa la sogs pas bgegs kyi gzugs brnyan byas nas brgya byin gyi gzugs brnyan rang gi phyogs na gnas pa la ai las brgya byin ser po /
translated: In the circle of light, he makes a form of the obstructing spirit out of substances such as an anthill and places it in his direction.🔽

original: me la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan la'ang de bzhin te /
analyzed: me la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan la'ang de bzhin te /
translated: In that circle of light, one should make a form of the obstructors with ant-hills and so forth, and a form of Indra with one's own side.🔽From I, Indra is yellow.

original: ram las me lha dmar po'o //
analyzed: ram las me lha dmar po'o //
translated: From Ra, the fire god is red.

original: aom ham las gshin rje nag po'o //
analyzed: aom ham las gshin rje nag po'o //
translated: From Om Ham, black Yama.

original: kram las srin po nag po /🔽bam las chu lha dkar po /
analyzed: kram las srin po nag po / bam las chu lha dkar po /
translated: From Ksham, black rakshasa.🔽From Bam, white Varuna.🔽From Yam, smoke-colored Vayu.

original: yang las rlung lha dud ka / phat las lus ngan po ser po /
analyzed: yang las rlung lha dud ka / phat las lus ngan po ser po /
translated: From Phat, yellow Kubera.🔽From Sumbha, white Ishana.

original: sumbha las dbang ldan dkar po bskyed la 'dod pa'i rgyal pos bkug ste /
analyzed: sumbha las dbang ldan dkar po bskyed la 'dod pa'i rgyal pos bkug ste /
translated: Having generated them, one should summon them with Kamadeva.

original: rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pas dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du byas nas phur bus gdab bo //
analyzed: rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pas dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du byas nas phur bus gdab bo //
translated: Having summoned, caused to enter, bound, and controlled them with the vajra hook and so forth, one should drive in the dagger.

original: shin tu yun ring du bgegs med par byed 'dod nas sa @89b dgab par bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu yun ring du bgegs med par byed 'dod nas sa @89b dgab par bya'o //
translated: If one wishes to be free of obstructors for a very long time, one should cover the ground.

original: de ltar na yang gal te bgegs byed na rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sbyor ba byas la 'dod pa'i rgyal pos bkug nas rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pas kyang dgug pa la sogs pa byas la /
analyzed: de ltar na yang gal te bgegs byed na rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sbyor ba byas la 'dod pa'i rgyal pos bkug nas rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pas kyang dgug pa la sogs pa byas la /
translated: If, in spite of that, there is an obstruction, one should perform the yoga of Vajra Humkara, summon with the king of desire, and summon, etc. with the vajra hook, etc.

original: rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi phyag rgya bcings te /
analyzed: rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi phyag rgya bcings te /
translated: Form the seal of Vajra Humkara,

original: rkang pa g-yon pas bgegs kyi gzugs brnyan mnan te /
analyzed: rkang pa g-yon pas bgegs kyi gzugs brnyan mnan te /
translated: and step on an image of the obstruction with the left foot.

original: h'um bam h'um zhes bya ba la sogs pa spel ba'i tshul gyis zlos shing g-yon brkyang ba'i gnas pas gnas na /
analyzed: h'um bam h'um zhes bya ba la sogs pa spel ba'i tshul gyis zlos shing g-yon brkyang ba'i gnas pas gnas na /
translated: If one recites the mantra “Hum bam hum” and so forth in the manner of the expansion, and remains in the position of the extended left leg,

original: de lta bus bgegs bcom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bus bgegs bcom par 'gyur ro //
translated: the obstruction will be destroyed by that.

original: yang na stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin sngon du bya ba'i rjes thogs la /
analyzed: yang na stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin sngon du bya ba'i rjes thogs la /
translated: Or else, following the prior meditative stabilization on emptiness,

original: aa las rnam par snang mdzad du gyur nas /
analyzed: aa las rnam par snang mdzad du gyur nas /
translated: one becomes Vairochana from the letter A.

original: rgyud las gsungs pa'i rnam par snang mdzad kyi skur nges par bsams la /
analyzed: rgyud las gsungs pa'i rnam par snang mdzad kyi skur nges par bsams la /
translated: One should imagine oneself definitely in the form of Vairochana as taught in the tantras.

original: rang gi snying gnas ham las 'phags pa mi g-yo ba yid kyis phyung ste /
analyzed: rang gi snying gnas ham las 'phags pa mi g-yo ba yid kyis phyung ste /
translated: From one’s heart, one mentally projects Noble Acala from the letter Ham.

original: badzra ham bandha zhes yid la zlos shing /
analyzed: badzra ham bandha zhes yid la zlos shing /
translated: Reciting vajra ham bandha

original: phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du rlung gi mtshams su dris thig le bdun byas te /🔽thig le re re zhing yang nang du chud par byas la /
analyzed: phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du rlung gi mtshams su dris thig le bdun byas te / thig le re re zhing yang nang du chud par byas la /
translated: outside the outer maṇḍala, one should make seven drops of water on the wind side.🔽Having made each drop, one should say vajra ham bandha

original: dbus ma dang thig le bdun dang ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: dbus ma dang thig le bdun dang ldan par bya'o //
translated: and make the drops in the middle and the seven drops.

original: thig le bdun po de dag kyang rlung lha bdun po mdog nag po ri dags la zhon par bsams la /
analyzed: thig le bdun po de dag kyang rlung lha bdun po mdog nag po ri dags la zhon par bsams la /
translated: One should imagine the seven drops as the seven wind gods, black in color, riding deer.

original: 'phags pa mi g-yo bas bkug nas zhags pas bcings par gyur par bsam mo //
analyzed: 'phags pa mi g-yo bas bkug nas zhags pas bcings par gyur par bsam mo //
translated: Having summoned them with Ārya Acalā, one should imagine that they are bound with a noose.

original: de rnams kyi dbus ma gcig ni gtso bo yin la /
analyzed: de rnams kyi dbus ma gcig ni gtso bo yin la /
translated: One of them is the principal one,

original: lhag ma rlung lha drug ni de'i 'khor du kun nas gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rlung lha drug ni de'i 'khor du kun nas gnas pa yin no //
translated: and the remaining six wind gods are situated all around him.

original: de nas kham phor aa las ri rab tu bsams la /
analyzed: de nas kham phor aa las ri rab tu bsams la /
translated: Then, one should imagine that the clay pot is Meru arisen from A.

original: de'i steng du aa nyid las dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du rdo rjes g-yogs la /
analyzed: de'i steng du aa nyid las dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du rdo rjes g-yogs la /
translated: On top of that, one should imagine that the maṇḍala of great power is covered everywhere with vajras arisen from A.🔽 One should imagine that the clay pot is Meru arisen from A.

original: dbus su yi ge h'um gi sa bon las byung ba'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa mtshams rnams su mdung rtse rnam par bsams la /
analyzed: dbus su yi ge h'um gi sa bon las byung ba'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa mtshams rnams su mdung rtse rnam par bsams la /
translated: In the center, one should imagine a five-pronged vajra arisen from the seed syllable hūṃ, with spears in the intermediate directions.

original: de bzhin du badzra ham bandha zhes zlos shing kham phor des ji skad bshad pa'i yi ge yam bdun po dgab par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du badzra ham bandha zhes zlos shing kham phor des ji skad bshad pa'i yi ge yam bdun po dgab par bya'o //
translated: Reciting “vajra-hūṃ-bandha,” one should cover the seven syllables as previously explained with the bowl.

original: de nas kham phor dang ri rab kyi steng du yi ge aom las sngar bshad pa'i bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad bsams la /
analyzed: de nas kham phor dang ri rab kyi steng du yi ge aom las sngar bshad pa'i bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad bsams la /
translated: Then, on the bowl and Mount Meru, from the seed syllable oṃ, one should imagine the previously explained Blessed Vairocana.

original: 'phags pa mi g-yo ba yang bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar g-yon brkyang ba'i gnas pas ri rab bzung nas ral gri dang zhags pas rlung lha rnams la bsdigs pa mdzad par bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa mi g-yo ba yang bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar g-yon brkyang ba'i gnas pas ri rab bzung nas ral gri dang zhags pas rlung lha rnams la bsdigs pa mdzad par bsam par bya ste /
translated: One should imagine that Ārya Acala, standing with his left leg straight, holds Mount Meru, and with his sword and noose threatens the Vāyu gods.

original: de lta bus ni rlung lha thams cad bcing bar @90a * //🔽byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bus ni rlung lha thams cad bcing bar @90a * // byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, all the Vāyu gods are bound.

original: de nas chu la sogs pa'i bgegs bzlog pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas chu la sogs pa'i bgegs bzlog pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Then, the prevention of obstacles of water, etc. should be explained.

original: yi ge h'um las 'phags pa mi g-yo ba rlung dang me'i dkyil 'khor la gnas par bdag nyid bskyed la /🔽grog mkhar gyi sa'am /
analyzed: yi ge h'um las 'phags pa mi g-yo ba rlung dang me'i dkyil 'khor la gnas par bdag nyid bskyed la / grog mkhar gyi sa'am /
translated: One should generate oneself as Ārya Acalanātha standing on a wind and fire maṇḍala from the letter hūṃ.🔽One should make a likeness of the obstructor from an ant hill

original: ba'i lci ba sa la ma lhung ba las bgegs kyi gzugs brnyan byas nas /🔽yi ge kham las ral gri dang / ram las nang na me yod par bskyed cing /
analyzed: ba'i lci ba sa la ma lhung ba las bgegs kyi gzugs brnyan byas nas / yi ge kham las ral gri dang / ram las nang na me yod par bskyed cing /
translated: or cow dung that has not fallen on the ground.🔽One should generate a sword from the letter khaṃ and fire inside from the letter raṃ.

original: ksham las zhags pa dang / lcags kyu bskyed de /
analyzed: ksham las zhags pa dang / lcags kyu bskyed de /
translated: One should generate a noose and a hook from the letter kṣaṃ.

original: de lag pa g-yon pas bzung la /
analyzed: de lag pa g-yon pas bzung la /
translated: One should hold that with one’s left hand.

original: lag pa g-yas pas ral gri dang / zhags pas drangs nas bgegs kyi gzugs brnyan gyi nang du bcug ste /
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pas ral gri dang / zhags pas drangs nas bgegs kyi gzugs brnyan gyi nang du bcug ste /
translated: One should draw with the sword and noose in one’s right hand and insert it into the likeness of the obstructor.

original: g-yon brkyang ba'i gnas pas gnas la /
analyzed: g-yon brkyang ba'i gnas pas gnas la /
translated: One should stand in the left-extended position.

original: rkang pa g-yon pas spyi bo nas btsir nas /
analyzed: rkang pa g-yon pas spyi bo nas btsir nas /
translated: One should press down with one’s left foot on the head.

original: na ma: sa manta badzr'a n'am tsanda ma h'a ro sha na spho ta ya h'um ta ga ham mam zhes zlos shing gzugs brnyan de ral gris gtub par bya ba'am /
analyzed: na ma: sa manta badzr'a n'am tsanda ma h'a ro sha na spho ta ya h'um ta ga ham mam zhes zlos shing gzugs brnyan de ral gris gtub par bya ba'am /
translated: Reciting “namaḥ samantabuddhānāṃ, caṇḍamahāroṣaṇa sphuṭaya hūṃ taṃ gaṃ maṃ,” one should cut the likeness with the sword.

original: dug dang ske tshe dang lan tshva la sogs pas gzugs brnyan la bskus la me yis gdung bar bya'o //
analyzed: dug dang ske tshe dang lan tshva la sogs pas gzugs brnyan la bskus la me yis gdung bar bya'o //
translated: One should smear the effigy with poison, black aconite, salt, and so forth, and torment it with fire.

original: me yis gdungs pas de nyid kyang //
analyzed: me yis gdungs pas de nyid kyang //
translated: By tormenting with fire,

original: zhi bar 'gyur bar the som med /
analyzed: zhi bar 'gyur bar the som med /
translated: there is no doubt that he will be pacified.

original: tshangs pa'am brgya byin yin na yang //
analyzed: tshangs pa'am brgya byin yin na yang //
translated: Even if he is Brahma or Indra,🔽he will quickly be destroyed by this mantra.

original: de'i mdo la myur du tshig / ces bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i mdo la myur du tshig / ces bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis gsungs so //
translated: Thus has the Blessed One Vairocana taught.

original: las 'di yang 'phags pa mi g-yo ba'i rnal 'byor gyis gsang sngags 'di khri bzlas pa'i sngon du bsnyen pa byas nas de'i 'og tu las brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: las 'di yang 'phags pa mi g-yo ba'i rnal 'byor gyis gsang sngags 'di khri bzlas pa'i sngon du bsnyen pa byas nas de'i 'og tu las brtsam par bya'o //
translated: One should perform the preliminary practice of this rite ten thousand times with the yoga of Noble Acala, reciting this mantra. Then, afterwards, one should commence the rite.

original: yang na aom a'a:h'um zhes bya ba 'dis 'phags pa 'jam dpal gshin rje gshed sku mdog nag po zhal bzhi pa phyag bzhi pa zhabs drug pa /🔽phyag g-yas gnyis na ral gri dang dgra sta bsnams pa /
analyzed: yang na aom a'a:h'um zhes bya ba 'dis 'phags pa 'jam dpal gshin rje gshed sku mdog nag po zhal bzhi pa phyag bzhi pa zhabs drug pa / phyag g-yas gnyis na ral gri dang dgra sta bsnams pa /
translated: Alternatively, with Om Aḥ Hūṃ, one should visualize Noble Mañjuśrī Yamāri, black, with four faces and six feet,🔽holding a sword and a battle-ax with the two right hands,

original: phyag g-yon gnyis na zhags pa dang gtun shing bsnams pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yon gnyis na zhags pa dang gtun shing bsnams pa /
translated: and a noose and a pestle with the two left hands.

original: lho phyogs su khro bo'i tshogs rnams kyis nam mkha'i gtos kun du gang bar mdzad pa bsams la /
analyzed: lho phyogs su khro bo'i tshogs rnams kyis nam mkha'i gtos kun du gang bar mdzad pa bsams la /
translated: In the south, the host of wrathful ones fills the entire expanse of the sky.

original: mdung thung gi phyag rgya bcings te /
analyzed: mdung thung gi phyag rgya bcings te /
translated: Form the spear-dart mudra.

original: sprin la sogs pa bzlog pa'i bsam pas tsham rngam dang bcas pas rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sprin la sogs pa bzlog pa'i bsam pas tsham rngam dang bcas pas rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: With the intention to ward off clouds and so forth, apply it with a fierce demeanor.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa nang du bcings la /
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa nang du bcings la /
translated: Form the vajra bond inside.

original: mdzub mo gnyis nang sbyar ba ni mdung thung gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis nang sbyar ba ni mdung thung gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The two index fingers are joined inside. This is the spear-dart mudra.

original: de ltar na yang gal te bgegs rnams zhi bar ma gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar na yang gal te bgegs rnams zhi bar ma gyur na /
translated: If in that way also the obstructors are not pacified,

original: kham phor so @90b ma btang ba gnyis kyi nang du khrag dang dur khrod kyi sol ba dang / dug dang ske tshe dang / da du ra'i lo ma'i khu bas gsang sngags bris la /
analyzed: kham phor so @90b ma btang ba gnyis kyi nang du khrag dang dur khrod kyi sol ba dang / dug dang ske tshe dang / da du ra'i lo ma'i khu bas gsang sngags bris la /
translated: write the mantra on two unfired clay bowls with blood, charnel ground ash, poison, black mustard seed, and datura leaf juice.

original: yungs kar la lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod byas la /
analyzed: yungs kar la lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod byas la /
translated: Recite the mantra one hundred and eight times over white mustard seed.

original: kham phor kha sbyar te de'i nang du bzhag la /
analyzed: kham phor kha sbyar te de'i nang du bzhag la /
translated: Place the two bowls together and put the mustard seed inside.

original: mi'i bgegs la sogs pa bsams te /
analyzed: mi'i bgegs la sogs pa bsams te /
translated: Imagine human obstructors and so forth.

original: sreg blugs brgya'am sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: sreg blugs brgya'am sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: One should offer one hundred or seven oblations.

original: de nas de dag 'jigs pa'am /
analyzed: de nas de dag 'jigs pa'am /
translated: Then they will be frightened,

original: 'chi ba'am / mi ma yin pas gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'chi ba'am / mi ma yin pas gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or they will die, or they will be seized by a non-human being.

original: yang na rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sbyor bas yi ge h'um bzlas brjod 'bum byas la /
analyzed: yang na rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sbyor bas yi ge h'um bzlas brjod 'bum byas la /
translated: Or else, by the method of Vajra Humkara, one should recite the syllable HŪM one hundred thousand times.

original: mi rus kyi rgyu las byas pa'i phur bu sor bzhi pa'i tshad tsam la lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas nas de bzhin du rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pas dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba byas nas gzugs brnyan phur bus gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: mi rus kyi rgyu las byas pa'i phur bu sor bzhi pa'i tshad tsam la lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas nas de bzhin du rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pas dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba byas nas gzugs brnyan phur bus gdab par bya'o //
translated: Having recited the mantra one hundred and eight times over a kīla made of human bone, four finger-breadths long, one should summon, induct, and bind with the Vajra Hook and so forth, and strike the effigy with the kīla.

original: de nas me'i tsha ba zhi ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas me'i tsha ba zhi ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: Then, the pacification of the heat of fire should be explained.

original: me'i steng du yi ge bam las chu'i dkyil 'khor ;
analyzed: me'i steng du yi ge bam las chu'i dkyil 'khor ;
translated: Above the fire, from the syllable BAṂ, there is a water maṇḍala.

original: de'i steng du padma'i dbus na gnas pa'i 'khor lo de'i steng du yi ge bam de nyid las bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad dung dang kun da ltar dkar ba steng na bzhugs te /
